page.title: 02Education
page.content:
Education
Education is started at the age of five when you start Primary school.The first three years of the Primary school is called the Infants.The last four are called the Juniors.The juniors usually have longer hours, and less attention is paid to each pupil. There are toys in the infants but none in the juniors.At the age of ten or eleven most children take the selection test.This decides which Secondary school they go to. From this test about 4% of the children go to Grammar school.There are five years in secondary school, or you can go on to a sixth year.In the fifth year you take O levels.These are examinations in different subjects.
